content: 1 THE song of songs, which is Solomon’s.
content_old: 1 THE song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

content: 2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: For thy love is better than wine.
content_old: 2 Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: For thy love is better than wine.

content: 3 Because of the savour of thy good ointments Thy name is as ointment poured forth, Therefore do the virgins love thee.
content_old: 3 Because of the savour of thy good ointments Thy name is as ointment poured forth, Therefore do the virgins love thee.

content: 4 Draw me, we will run after thee: The king hath brought me into his chambers: We will be glad and rejoice in thee, We will remember thy love more than wine: The upright love thee.
content_old: 4 Draw me, we will run after thee: The king hath brought me into his chambers: We will be glad and rejoice in thee, We will remember thy love more than wine: The upright love thee.

content: 5 I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, As the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.
content_old: 5 I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, As the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

content: 6 Look not upon me, because I am black, Because the sun hath looked upon me: My mother’s children were angry with me; They made me the keeper of the vineyards; But mine own vineyard have I not kept.
content_old: 6 Look not upon me, because I am black, Because the sun hath looked upon me: My mother’s children were angry with me; They made me the keeper of the vineyards; But mine own vineyard have I not kept.

content: 7 Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, Where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: For why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?
content_old: 7 Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, Where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: For why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

content: 8 If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, Go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, And feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.
content_old: 8 If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, Go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, And feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.

content: 9 I have compared thee, O my love, To a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.
content_old: 9 I have compared thee, O my love, To a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.

content: 10 Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, Thy neck with chains of gold.
content_old: 10 Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, Thy neck with chains of gold.

content: 11 We will make thee borders of gold With studs of silver.
content_old: 11 We will make thee borders of gold With studs of silver.

content: 12 While the king sitteth at his table, My spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.
content_old: 12 While the king sitteth at his table, My spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.

content: 13 A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; He shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.
content_old: 13 A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; He shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

content: 14 My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire In the vineyards of En-gedi.
content_old: 14 My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire In the vineyards of En-gedi.

content: 15 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; Thou hast doves’ eyes.
content_old: 15 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; Thou hast doves’ eyes.

content: 16 Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: Also our bed is green.
content_old: 16 Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: Also our bed is green.

content: 1 I am the rose of Sharon, And the lily of the valleys.
content_old: 1 I am the rose of Sharon, And the lily of the valleys.

content: 2 As the lily among thorns, So is my love among the daughters.
content_old: 2 As the lily among thorns, So is my love among the daughters.

content: 3 As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, So is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, And his fruit was sweet to my taste.
content_old: 3 As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, So is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, And his fruit was sweet to my taste.

content: 4 He brought me to the banqueting house, And his banner over me was love.
content_old: 4 He brought me to the banqueting house, And his banner over me was love.

content: 5 Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: For I am sick of love.
content_old: 5 Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: For I am sick of love.

content: 6 His left hand is under my head, And his right hand doth embrace me.
content_old: 6 His left hand is under my head, And his right hand doth embrace me.

content: 7 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, and by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
content_old: 7 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, and by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

content: 8 The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh Leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
content_old: 8 The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh Leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

content: 9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: Behold, he standeth behind our wall, He looketh forth at the windows, Shewing himself through the lattice.
content_old: 9 My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: Behold, he standeth behind our wall, He looketh forth at the windows, Shewing himself through the lattice.

content: 10 My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.
content_old: 10 My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

content: 11 For, lo, the winter is past, The rain is over and gone;
content_old: 11 For, lo, the winter is past, The rain is over and gone;

content: 12 The flowers appear on the earth; The time of the singing of birds is come, And the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;
content_old: 12 The flowers appear on the earth; The time of the singing of birds is come, And the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

content: 13 The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, And the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
content_old: 13 The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, And the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

content: 14 O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, Let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; For sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.
content_old: 14 O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, Let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; For sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.

content: 15 Take us the foxes, The little foxes, that spoil the vines: For our vines have tender grapes.
content_old: 15 Take us the foxes, The little foxes, that spoil the vines: For our vines have tender grapes.

content: 16 My beloved is mine, and I am his: He feedeth among the lilies.
content_old: 16 My beloved is mine, and I am his: He feedeth among the lilies.

content: 1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
content_old: 1 By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

content: 2 I will rise now, and go about the city In the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
content_old: 2 I will rise now, and go about the city In the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.

content: 3 The watchmen that go about the city found me: To whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?
content_old: 3 The watchmen that go about the city found me: To whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?

content: 4 It was but a little that I passed from them, But I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, Until I had brought him into my mother’s house, And into the chamber of her that conceived me.
content_old: 4 It was but a little that I passed from them, But I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, Until I had brought him into my mother’s house, And into the chamber of her that conceived me.

content: 5 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, and by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
content_old: 5 I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, By the roes, and by the hinds of the field, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

content: 6 Who is this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, Perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, With all powders of the merchant?
content_old: 6 Who is this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, Perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, With all powders of the merchant?

content: 7 Behold his bed, which is Solomon’s; Threescore valiant men are about it, Of the valiant of Israel.
content_old: 7 Behold his bed, which is Solomon’s; Threescore valiant men are about it, Of the valiant of Israel.

content: 8 They all hold swords, being expert in war: Every man hath his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.
content_old: 8 They all hold swords, being expert in war: Every man hath his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.

content: 9 King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon.
content_old: 9 King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon.

content: 10 He made the pillars thereof of silver, The bottom thereof of gold, The covering of it of purple, The midst thereof being paved with love, for the daughters of Jerusalem.
content_old: 10 He made the pillars thereof of silver, The bottom thereof of gold, The covering of it of purple, The midst thereof being paved with love, for the daughters of Jerusalem.

content: 1 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; Thou hast doves’ eyes within thy locks: Thy hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.
content_old: 1 Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; Thou hast doves’ eyes within thy locks: Thy hair is as a flock of goats, that appear from mount Gilead.

content: 2 Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from the washing; Whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them.
content_old: 2 Thy teeth are like a flock of sheep that are even shorn, which came up from the washing; Whereof every one bear twins, and none is barren among them.

content: 3 Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely: Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.
content_old: 3 Thy lips are like a thread of scarlet, and thy speech is comely: Thy temples are like a piece of a pomegranate within thy locks.

content: 4 Thy neck is like the tower of David Builded for an armoury, Whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.
content_old: 4 Thy neck is like the tower of David Builded for an armoury, Whereon there hang a thousand bucklers, all shields of mighty men.

content: 5 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, Which feed among the lilies.
content_old: 5 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins, Which feed among the lilies.

content: 6 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.
content_old: 6 Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, I will get me to the mountain of myrrh, and to the hill of frankincense.

content: 7 Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee.
content_old: 7 Thou art all fair, my love; there is no spot in thee.

content: 8 Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: Look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, From the lions’ dens, from the mountains of the leopards.
content_old: 8 Come with me from Lebanon, my spouse, with me from Lebanon: Look from the top of Amana, from the top of Shenir and Hermon, From the lions’ dens, from the mountains of the leopards.

content: 9 Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; Thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, With one chain of thy neck.
content_old: 9 Thou hast ravished my heart, my sister, my spouse; Thou hast ravished my heart with one of thine eyes, With one chain of thy neck.

content: 10 How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! How much better is thy love than wine! And the smell of thine ointments than all spices!
content_old: 10 How fair is thy love, my sister, my spouse! How much better is thy love than wine! And the smell of thine ointments than all spices!

content: 11 Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: Honey and milk are under thy tongue; And the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.
content_old: 11 Thy lips, O my spouse, drop as the honeycomb: Honey and milk are under thy tongue; And the smell of thy garments is like the smell of Lebanon.

content: 12 A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; A spring shut up, a fountain sealed.
content_old: 12 A garden inclosed is my sister, my spouse; A spring shut up, a fountain sealed.

content: 13 Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; Camphire, with spikenard,
content_old: 13 Thy plants are an orchard of pomegranates, with pleasant fruits; Camphire, with spikenard,

content: 14 Spikenard and saffron; Calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; Myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:
content_old: 14 Spikenard and saffron; Calamus and cinnamon, with all trees of frankincense; Myrrh and aloes, with all the chief spices:

content: 15 A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, And streams from Lebanon.
content_old: 15 A fountain of gardens, a well of living waters, And streams from Lebanon.

content: 1 I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: Eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.
content_old: 1 I am come into my garden, my sister, my spouse: I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk: Eat, O friends; drink, yea, drink abundantly, O beloved.

content: 2 I sleep, but my heart waketh: It is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: For my head is filled with dew, And my locks with the drops of the night.
content_old: 2 I sleep, but my heart waketh: It is the voice of my beloved that knocketh, saying, Open to me, my sister, my love, my dove, my undefiled: For my head is filled with dew, And my locks with the drops of the night.

content: 3 I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?
content_old: 3 I have put off my coat; how shall I put it on? I have washed my feet; how shall I defile them?

content: 4 My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, And my bowels were moved for him.
content_old: 4 My beloved put in his hand by the hole of the door, And my bowels were moved for him.

content: 5 I rose up to open to my beloved; And my hands dropped with myrrh, And my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, Upon the handles of the lock.
content_old: 5 I rose up to open to my beloved; And my hands dropped with myrrh, And my fingers with sweet smelling myrrh, Upon the handles of the lock.

content: 6 I opened to my beloved; But my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: My soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.
content_old: 6 I opened to my beloved; But my beloved had withdrawn himself, and was gone: My soul failed when he spake: I sought him, but I could not find him; I called him, but he gave me no answer.

content: 7 The watchmen that went about the city found me, They smote me, they wounded me; The keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.
content_old: 7 The watchmen that went about the city found me, They smote me, they wounded me; The keepers of the walls took away my veil from me.

content: 8 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, If ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, That I am sick of love.
content_old: 8 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, If ye find my beloved, that ye tell him, That I am sick of love.

content: 9 What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? What is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?
content_old: 9 What is thy beloved more than another beloved, O thou fairest among women? What is thy beloved more than another beloved, that thou dost so charge us?

content: 10 My beloved is white and ruddy, The chiefest among ten thousand.
content_old: 10 My beloved is white and ruddy, The chiefest among ten thousand.

content: 11 His head is as the most fine gold, His locks are bushy, and black as a raven.
content_old: 11 His head is as the most fine gold, His locks are bushy, and black as a raven.

content: 12 His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, Washed with milk, and fitly set.
content_old: 12 His eyes are as the eyes of doves by the rivers of waters, Washed with milk, and fitly set.

content: 13 His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: His lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.
content_old: 13 His cheeks are as a bed of spices, as sweet flowers: His lips like lilies, dropping sweet smelling myrrh.

content: 14 His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: His belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.
content_old: 14 His hands are as gold rings set with the beryl: His belly is as bright ivory overlaid with sapphires.

content: 15 His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: His countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.
content_old: 15 His legs are as pillars of marble, set upon sockets of fine gold: His countenance is as Lebanon, excellent as the cedars.

content: 1 Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? Whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
content_old: 1 Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? Whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

content: 2 My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, To feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
content_old: 2 My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, To feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

content: 3 I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: He feedeth among the lilies.
content_old: 3 I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: He feedeth among the lilies.

content: 4 Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, Comely as Jerusalem, Terrible as an army with banners.
content_old: 4 Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, Comely as Jerusalem, Terrible as an army with banners.

content: 5 Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: Thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
content_old: 5 Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: Thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

content: 6 Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, Whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.
content_old: 6 Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, Whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.

content: 7 As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.
content_old: 7 As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.

content: 8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, And virgins without number.
content_old: 8 There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, And virgins without number.

content: 9 My dove, my undefiled is but one; She is the only one of her mother, She is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; Yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
content_old: 9 My dove, my undefiled is but one; She is the only one of her mother, She is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; Yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

content: 10 Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, Fair as the moon, clear as the sun, And terrible as an army with banners?
content_old: 10 Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, Fair as the moon, clear as the sun, And terrible as an army with banners?

content: 11 I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, And to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.
content_old: 11 I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, And to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.

content: 12 Or ever I was aware, My soul made me like the chariots of Ammi-nadib.
content_old: 12 Or ever I was aware, My soul made me like the chariots of Ammi-nadib.

content: 1 How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince’s daughter! The joints of thy thighs are like jewels, The work of the hands of a cunning workman.
content_old: 1 How beautiful are thy feet with shoes, O prince’s daughter! The joints of thy thighs are like jewels, The work of the hands of a cunning workman.

content: 2 Thy navel is like a round goblet, which wanteth not liquor: Thy belly is like an heap of wheat set about with lilies.
content_old: 2 Thy navel is like a round goblet, which wanteth not liquor: Thy belly is like an heap of wheat set about with lilies.

content: 3 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins.
content_old: 3 Thy two breasts are like two young roes that are twins.

content: 4 Thy neck is as a tower of ivory; Thine eyes like the fishpools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bath-rabbim: Thy nose is as the tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus.
content_old: 4 Thy neck is as a tower of ivory; Thine eyes like the fishpools in Heshbon, by the gate of Bath-rabbim: Thy nose is as the tower of Lebanon which looketh toward Damascus.

content: 5 Thine head upon thee is like Carmel, And the hair of thine head like purple; The king is held in the galleries.
content_old: 5 Thine head upon thee is like Carmel, And the hair of thine head like purple; The king is held in the galleries.

content: 6 How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!
content_old: 6 How fair and how pleasant art thou, O love, for delights!

content: 7 This thy stature is like to a palm tree, And thy breasts to clusters of grapes.
content_old: 7 This thy stature is like to a palm tree, And thy breasts to clusters of grapes.

content: 8 I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: Now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, And the smell of thy nose like apples;
content_old: 8 I said, I will go up to the palm tree, I will take hold of the boughs thereof: Now also thy breasts shall be as clusters of the vine, And the smell of thy nose like apples;

content: 9 And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine For my beloved, that goeth down sweetly, Causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.
content_old: 9 And the roof of thy mouth like the best wine For my beloved, that goeth down sweetly, Causing the lips of those that are asleep to speak.

content: 10 I am my beloved’s, and his desire is toward me.
content_old: 10 I am my beloved’s, and his desire is toward me.

content: 11 Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; Let us lodge in the villages.
content_old: 11 Come, my beloved, let us go forth into the field; Let us lodge in the villages.

content: 12 Let us get up early to the vineyards; Let us see if the vine flourish, whether the tender grape appear, And the pomegranates bud forth: There will I give thee my loves.
content_old: 12 Let us get up early to the vineyards; Let us see if the vine flourish, whether the tender grape appear, And the pomegranates bud forth: There will I give thee my loves.

content: 1 O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! When I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; Yea, I should not be despised.
content_old: 1 O that thou wert as my brother, that sucked the breasts of my mother! When I should find thee without, I would kiss thee; Yea, I should not be despised.

content: 2 I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.
content_old: 2 I would lead thee, and bring thee into my mother’s house, who would instruct me: I would cause thee to drink of spiced wine of the juice of my pomegranate.

content: 3 His left hand should be under my head, And his right hand should embrace me.
content_old: 3 His left hand should be under my head, And his right hand should embrace me.

content: 4 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.
content_old: 4 I charge you, O daughters of Jerusalem, That ye stir not up, nor awake my love, until he please.

content: 5 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, Leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: There thy mother brought thee forth: There she brought thee forth that bare thee.
content_old: 5 Who is this that cometh up from the wilderness, Leaning upon her beloved? I raised thee up under the apple tree: There thy mother brought thee forth: There she brought thee forth that bare thee.

content: 6 Set me as a seal upon thine heart, As a seal upon thine arm: For love is strong as death; Jealousy is cruel as the grave: The coals thereof are coals of fire, Which hath a most vehement flame.
content_old: 6 Set me as a seal upon thine heart, As a seal upon thine arm: For love is strong as death; Jealousy is cruel as the grave: The coals thereof are coals of fire, Which hath a most vehement flame.

content: 7 Many waters cannot quench love, Neither can the floods drown it: If a man would give all the substance of his house for love, It would utterly be contemned.
content_old: 7 Many waters cannot quench love, Neither can the floods drown it: If a man would give all the substance of his house for love, It would utterly be contemned.

content: 8 We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: What shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?
content_old: 8 We have a little sister, and she hath no breasts: What shall we do for our sister in the day when she shall be spoken for?

content: 9 If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: And if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.
content_old: 9 If she be a wall, we will build upon her a palace of silver: And if she be a door, we will inclose her with boards of cedar.

content: 10 I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: Then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.
content_old: 10 I am a wall, and my breasts like towers: Then was I in his eyes as one that found favour.

content: 11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; He let out the vineyard unto keepers; Every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.
content_old: 11 Solomon had a vineyard at Baal-hamon; He let out the vineyard unto keepers; Every one for the fruit thereof was to bring a thousand pieces of silver.

content: 12 My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: Thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, And those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.
content_old: 12 My vineyard, which is mine, is before me: Thou, O Solomon, must have a thousand, And those that keep the fruit thereof two hundred.

content: 13 Thou that dwellest in the gardens, The companions hearken to thy voice: Cause me to hear it.
content_old: 13 Thou that dwellest in the gardens, The companions hearken to thy voice: Cause me to hear it.
